✈️ Week 4: Travel & Transportation

day 22

  1. 旅行 (lǚxíng)
    • pinyin: lǚxíng
    • definition: to travel; journey; trip
    • usage: making a journey, typically of some length or abroad.
    • example: 我喜欢独自旅行。(wǒ xǐhuān dúzì lǚxíng.) - i like to travel alone.
    • contexts: travel, holidays, leisure.
  2. 目的地 (mùdìdì)
    • pinyin: mùdìdì
    • definition: destination
    • usage: the place to which someone or something is going or being sent.
    • example: 我们下一个目的地是哪里？(wǒmen xià yī gè mùdìdì shì nǎlǐ?) - where is our next destination?
    • contexts: travel, navigation, logistics.
  3. 行程 (xíngchéng)
    • pinyin: xíngchéng
    • definition: itinerary; route; journey
    • usage: a planned route or journey.
    • example: 请确认一下我们的行程安排。(qǐng quèrèn yīxià wǒmen de xíngchéng ānpái.) - please confirm our itinerary arrangements.
    • contexts: travel planning, tours, business trips.
  4. 护照 (hùzhào)
    • pinyin: hùzhào
    • definition: passport
    • usage: an official document issued by a government, certifying the holder’s identity and citizenship and entitling them to travel under its protection to and from foreign countries.
    • example: 出国旅行别忘了带护照。(chūguó lǚxíng bié wàng le dài hùzhào.) - don’t forget to bring your passport when traveling abroad.
    • contexts: international travel, official documents.
  5. 签证 (qiānzhèng)
    • pinyin: qiānzhèng
    • definition: visa
    • usage: an endorsement on a passport indicating that the holder is allowed to enter, leave, or stay for a specified period of time in a country.
    • example: 我需要办理去美国的签证。(wǒ xūyào bànlǐ qù měiguó de qiānzhèng.) - i need to apply for a visa to the united states.
    • contexts: international travel, immigration, official documents.
  6. 机票 (jīpiào)
    • pinyin: jīpiào
    • definition: plane ticket; air ticket
    • usage: a ticket for a journey on an aircraft.
    • example: 我已经预订了往返机票。(wǒ yǐjīng yùdìng le wǎngfǎn jīpiào.) - i have already booked a round-trip plane ticket.
    • contexts: air travel, booking, transportation.
  7. 航班 (hángbān)
    • pinyin: hángbān
    • definition: scheduled flight; flight number
    • usage: a journey made by air, especially in a plane; the particular flight identified by its number.
    • example: 我们的航班延误了。(wǒmen de hángbān yánwù le.) - our flight has been delayed.
    • contexts: air travel, airports, flight information.
  8. 机场 (jīchǎng)
    • pinyin: jīchǎng
    • definition: airport
    • usage: a complex of runways and buildings for the takeoff, landing, accommodation, and maintenance of aircraft, with facilities for passengers and cargo.
    • example: 我们需要提前三个小时到达机场。(wǒmen xūyào tíqián sān gè xiǎoshí dàodá jīchǎng.) - we need to arrive at the airport three hours in advance.
    • contexts: air travel, transportation hubs.
  9. 登机口 (dēngjīkǒu)
    • pinyin: dēngjīkǒu
    • definition: boarding gate (at an airport)
    • usage: the gate in an airport where passengers board their aircraft.
    • example: 请问飞往北京的航班在哪个登机口？(qǐngwèn fēi wǎng běijīng de hángbān zài nǎge dēngjīkǒu?) - excuse me, which boarding gate is for the flight to beijing?
    • contexts: airports, air travel.
  10. 行李 (xíngli)
    • pinyin: xíngli
    • definition: luggage; baggage
    • usage: cases and bags used to carry belongings when traveling.
    • example: 我的行李超重了。(wǒ de xíngli chāozhòng le.) - my luggage is overweight.
    • contexts: travel, airports, packing.

day 23

  1. 托运 (tuōyùn)
    • pinyin: tuōyùn
    • definition: to check in (luggage); to consign for shipment
    • usage: to hand over luggage to an airline to be transported in the cargo hold of an aircraft.
    • example: 我需要托运这件行李。(wǒ xūyào tuōyùn zhè jiàn xíngli.) - i need to check in this piece of luggage.
    • contexts: airports, air travel, luggage.
  2. 随身携带 (suíshēn xiédài)
    • pinyin: suíshēn xiédài
    • definition: to carry on (luggage); to bring with oneself
    • usage: refers to luggage or items that a passenger is allowed to carry aboard an aircraft or other vehicle.
    • example: 这件小行李我可以随身携带。(zhè jiàn xiǎo xíngli wǒ kěyǐ suíshēn xiédài.) - i can carry this small piece of luggage on board.
    • contexts: air travel, luggage regulations, security.
  3. 安检 (ānjiǎn)
    • pinyin: ānjiǎn
    • definition: security check
    • usage: an examination of a person or their belongings to ensure they are not carrying dangerous or prohibited items, especially at an airport.
    • example: 我们需要通过安检才能登机。(wǒmen xūyào tōngguò ānjiǎn cáinéng dēngjī.) - we need to go through the security check before boarding.
    • contexts: airports, security, travel procedures.
  4. 海关 (hǎiguān)
    • pinyin: hǎiguān
    • definition: customs (border control)
    • usage: the official department that administers and collects the duties levied by a government on imported goods.
    • example: 入境时需要通过海关检查。(rùjìng shí xūyào tōngguò hǎiguān jiǎnchá.) - you need to pass through customs inspection upon entry.
    • contexts: international travel, borders, government.
  5. 酒店 (jiǔdiàn)
    • pinyin: jiǔdiàn
    • definition: hotel; large restaurant (sometimes)
    • usage: an establishment providing accommodation, meals, and other services for travelers and tourists. can sometimes also refer to a large, often high-end, restaurant.
    • example: 我已经预订了市中心的酒店。(wǒ yǐjīng yùdìng le shìzhōngxīn de jiǔdiàn.) - i have already booked a hotel in the city center.
    • contexts: travel, accommodation, hospitality.
  6. 预订 (yùdìng)
    • pinyin: yùdìng
    • definition: to reserve; to book (a ticket, a hotel room, etc.)
    • usage: to arrange for (a room, seat, ticket, etc.) to be kept for one’s use.
    • example: 你预订机票和酒店了吗？(nǐ yùdìng jīpiào hé jiǔdiàn le ma?) - have you booked your flight ticket and hotel?
    • contexts: travel planning, accommodation, tickets.
  7. 入住 (rùzhù)
    • pinyin: rùzhù
    • definition: to check in (at a hotel)
    • usage: to arrive and register at a hotel or guesthouse.
    • example: 我们下午三点可以办理入住手续。(wǒmen xiàwǔ sāndiǎn kěyǐ bànlǐ rùzhù shǒuxù.) - we can check in at 3 pm.
    • contexts: hotels, accommodation, travel procedures.
  8. 退房 (tuìfáng)
    • pinyin: tuìfáng
    • definition: to check out (of a hotel)
    • usage: to settle one’s bill and leave a hotel.
    • example: 明天中午十二点前必须退房。(míngtiān zhōngwǔ shí’èr diǎn qián bìxū tuìfáng.) - we must check out before 12 noon tomorrow.
    • contexts: hotels, accommodation, travel procedures.
  9. 交通 (jiāotōng)
    • pinyin: jiāotōng
    • definition: transportation; traffic
    • usage: the system or means of conveying people or goods from place to place; vehicles moving on a road or in an area.
    • example: 这个城市的交通很方便。(zhège chéngshì de jiāotōng hěn fāngbiàn.) - the transportation in this city is very convenient.
    • contexts: urban life, travel, logistics.
  10. 公共交通 (gōnggòng jiāotōng)
    • pinyin: gōnggòng jiāotōng
    • definition: public transportation
    • usage: buses, trains, subways, and other forms of transport that are available to the public, charge set fares, and run on fixed routes.
    • example: 我通常乘坐公共交通上下班。(wǒ tōngcháng chéngzuò gōnggòng jiāotōng shàngxiàbān.) - i usually take public transportation to commute.
    • contexts: urban life, travel, environment.

day 24

  1. 地铁 (dìtiě)
    • pinyin: dìtiě
    • definition: subway; metro; underground railway
    • usage: an underground electric railway.
    • example: 坐地铁去市中心很快。(zuò dìtiě qù shìzhōngxīn hěn kuài.) - taking the subway to the city center is very fast.
    • contexts: urban transportation, daily commute.
  2. 公交车 (gōngjiāochē)
    • pinyin: gōngjiāochē
    • definition: public bus
    • usage: a large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road, typically one serving the public on a fixed route and for a set fare.
    • example: 我每天坐公交车上学。(wǒ měitiān zuò gōngjiāochē shàngxué.) - i take the public bus to school every day.
    • contexts: urban transportation, daily commute.
  3. 出租车 (chūzūchē)
    • pinyin: chūzūchē
    • definition: taxi; cab
    • usage: a car licensed to transport passengers in return for payment of a fare.
    • example: 如果赶时间，我们可以打出租车。(rúguǒ gǎn shíjiān, wǒmen kěyǐ dǎ chūzūchē.) - if we are in a hurry, we can take a taxi.
    • contexts: transportation, convenience.
  4. 网约车 (wǎngyuēchē)
    • pinyin: wǎngyuēchē
    • definition: ride-hailing service car (e.g., didi, uber)
    • usage: a car service requested via a mobile app.
    • example: 现在叫网约车很方便。(xiànzài jiào wǎngyuēchē hěn fāngbiàn.) - it’s very convenient to hail a ride online now.
    • contexts: transportation, technology, convenience.
  5. 火车 (huǒchē)
    • pinyin: huǒchē
    • definition: train
    • usage: a series of railroad cars moved as a unit by a locomotive or by integral motors.
    • example: 我计划坐火车去邻近的城市。(wǒ jìhuà zuò huǒchē qù línjìn de chéngshì.) - i plan to take a train to the neighboring city.
    • contexts: long-distance travel, transportation.
  6. 高铁 (gāotiě)
    • pinyin: gāotiě
    • definition: high-speed rail
    • usage: a type of rail transport that operates significantly faster than traditional rail traffic, using an integrated system of specialized rolling stock and dedicated tracks.
    • example: 乘坐高铁既快速又舒适。(chéngzuò gāotiě jì kuàisù yòu shūshì.) - traveling by high-speed rail is both fast and comfortable.
    • contexts: modern transportation, long-distance travel, china.
  7. 车站 (chēzhàn)
    • pinyin: chēzhàn
    • definition: station (bus or train)
    • usage: a building where buses or trains regularly stop, allowing passengers to board or alight.
    • example: 火车站在哪里？(huǒchēzhàn zài nǎlǐ?) - where is the train station?
    • contexts: transportation hubs, travel.
  8. 售票处 (shòupiàochù)
    • pinyin: shòupiàochù
    • definition: ticket office; booking office
    • usage: a place where tickets are sold.
    • example: 你可以去售票处买票。(nǐ kěyǐ qù shòupiàochù mǎipiào.) - you can go to the ticket office to buy tickets.
    • contexts: train stations, airports, cinemas, events.
  9. 候车室 (hòuchēshì)
    • pinyin: hòuchēshì
    • definition: waiting room (for a train or bus)
    • usage: a room provided for the use of people waiting for a train or bus.
    • example: 我们在候车室等火车。(wǒmen zài hòuchēshì děng huǒchē.) - we are waiting for the train in the waiting room.
    • contexts: train stations, bus stations.
  10. 站台 (zhàntái)
    • pinyin: zhàntái
    • definition: platform (at a train or subway station)
    • usage: a raised level surface alongside a railway track where passengers can board and alight from trains.
    • example: 请在三号站台等候列车。(qǐng zài sānhào zhàntái děnghòu lièchē.) - please wait for the train on platform three.
    • contexts: train stations, subway stations.

day 25

  1. 租车 (zūchē)
    • pinyin: zūchē
    • definition: to rent a car; car rental
    • usage: to pay a fee to use a car for a specific period.
    • example: 我们在机场租了一辆车。(wǒmen zài jīchǎng zū le yī liàng chē.) - we rented a car at the airport.
    • contexts: travel, transportation, driving.
  2. 自驾游 (zìjiàyóu)
    • pinyin: zìjiàyóu
    • definition: self-driving tour; road trip
    • usage: a journey made by car, typically for pleasure, where one drives oneself.
    • example: 他们计划夏天进行一次自驾游。(tāmen jìhuà xiàtiān jìnxíng yīcì zìjiàyóu.) - they are planning a road trip for the summer.
    • contexts: travel, leisure, driving.
  3. 地图 (dìtú)
    • pinyin: dìtú
    • definition: map
    • usage: a diagrammatic representation of an area of land or sea showing physical features, cities, roads, etc.
    • example: 你有这个城市的地图吗？(nǐ yǒu zhège chéngshì de dìtú ma?) - do you have a map of this city?
    • contexts: navigation, travel, geography.
  4. 导航 (dǎoháng)
    • pinyin: dǎoháng
    • definition: navigation; GPS; to navigate
    • usage: the process or activity of accurately ascertaining one’s position and planning and following a route; a GPS device.
    • example: 我开车时通常使用手机导航。(wǒ kāichē shí tōngcháng shǐyòng shǒujī dǎoháng.) - i usually use my phone for navigation when driving.
    • contexts: driving, travel, technology.
  5. 加油站 (jiāyóuzhàn)
    • pinyin: jiāyóuzhàn
    • definition: gas station; petrol station
    • usage: an establishment beside a road selling fuel for motor vehicles.
    • example: 我们需要找个加油站加油。(wǒmen xūyào zhǎo gè jiāyóuzhàn jiāyóu.) - we need to find a gas station to refuel.
    • contexts: driving, road trips.
  6. 堵车 (dǔchē)
    • pinyin: dǔchē
    • definition: traffic jam; to be stuck in traffic
    • usage: a line or lines of stationary or very slow-moving traffic.
    • example: 上下班高峰期很容易堵车。(shàngxiàbān gāofēngqī hěn róngyì dǔchē.) - it’s easy to get stuck in traffic during rush hour.
    • contexts: urban life, driving, commuting.
  7. 景点 (jǐngdiǎn)
    • pinyin: jǐngdiǎn
    • definition: scenic spot; tourist attraction
    • usage: a place of interest where tourists visit, typically for its natural or cultural value, historical significance, or beauty.
    • example: 这个城市有很多著名的景点。(zhège chéngshì yǒu hěnduō zhùmíng de jǐngdiǎn.) - this city has many famous tourist attractions.
    • contexts: tourism, travel, sightseeing.
  8. 导游 (dǎoyóu)
    • pinyin: dǎoyóu
    • definition: tour guide
    • usage: a person employed to show tourists around places of interest.
    • example: 我们雇了一位当地导游。(wǒmen gù le yī wèi dāngdì dǎoyóu.) - we hired a local tour guide.
    • contexts: tourism, travel, sightseeing.
  9. 旅行社 (lǚxíngshè)
    • pinyin: lǚxíngshè
    • definition: travel agency
    • usage: a public or private company that makes travel arrangements for people.
    • example: 我通过旅行社预订了这次旅行。(wǒ tōngguò lǚxíngshè yùdìng le zhè cì lǚxíng.) - i booked this trip through a travel agency.
    • contexts: travel planning, tourism industry.
  10. 纪念品 (jìniànpǐn)
    • pinyin: jìniànpǐn
    • definition: souvenir
    • usage: a thing that is kept as a reminder of a person, place, or event.
    • example: 我买了一些当地的纪念品。(wǒ mǎi le yīxiē dāngdì de jìniànpǐn.) - i bought some local souvenirs.
    • contexts: travel, shopping, gifts.

day 26

  1. 风景 (fēngjǐng)
    • pinyin: fēngjǐng
    • definition: scenery; landscape
    • usage: the general appearance of a place; the natural features of a landscape.
    • example: 这里的风景真美！(zhèlǐ de fēngjǐng zhēn měi!) - the scenery here is so beautiful!
    • contexts: travel, nature, photography, art.
  2. 自然风光 (zìrán fēngguāng)
    • pinyin: zìrán fēngguāng
    • definition: natural scenery; natural beauty
    • usage: the landscapes and features of the natural world, as distinct from those created by humans.
    • example: 我喜欢欣赏大自然的风光。(wǒ xǐhuān xīnshǎng dà zìrán de fēngguāng.) - i like to admire natural scenery.
    • contexts: travel, nature, environment, geography.
  3. 名胜古迹 (míngshèng gǔjì)
    • pinyin: míngshèng gǔjì
    • definition: famous scenic spots and historic sites
    • usage: places well-known for their beauty or historical importance.
    • example: 中国有很多名胜古迹值得一游。(zhōngguó yǒu hěnduō míngshèng gǔjì zhíde yī yóu.) - china has many famous scenic spots and historic sites worth visiting.
    • contexts: tourism, history, culture, travel.
  4. 自由行 (zìyóuxíng)
    • pinyin: zìyóuxíng
    • definition: independent travel (not with a tour group)
    • usage: a way of traveling where you plan your own itinerary and are not part of an organized tour group.
    • example: 我更喜欢自由行，不喜欢跟团。(wǒ gèng xǐhuān zìyóuxíng, bù xǐhuān gēn tuán.) - i prefer independent travel, i don’t like to travel with a tour group.
    • contexts: travel styles, planning, preferences.
  5. 跟团游 (gēntuányóu)
    • pinyin: gēntuányóu
    • definition: group tour; to travel with a tour group
    • usage: traveling as part of an organized group with a pre-arranged itinerary.
    • example: 跟团游比较省心，但可能不太自由。(gēntuányóu bǐjiào shěngxīn, dàn kěnéng bù tài zìyóu.) - traveling with a tour group is less hassle, but perhaps not very flexible.
    • contexts: travel styles, tourism industry.
  6. 青年旅社 (qīngnián lǚshè)
    • pinyin: qīngnián lǚshè
    • definition: youth hostel
    • usage: an inexpensive type of lodging, typically with dormitory-style rooms, catering mainly to young travelers.
    • example: 预算有限的旅客可以选择住青年旅社。(yùsuàn yǒuxiàn de lǚkè kěyǐ xuǎnzé zhù qīngnián lǚshè.) - travelers on a limited budget can choose to stay in a youth hostel.
    • contexts: budget travel, accommodation, backpacking.
  7. 民宿 (mínsù)
    • pinyin: mínsù
    • definition: guesthouse; bed and breakfast (b&b); homestay
    • usage: a type of lodging in a private home, or a small, independently run guesthouse.
    • example: 我们在乡下订了一家民宿。(wǒmen zài xiāngxià dìng le yī jiā mínsù.) - we booked a guesthouse in the countryside.
    • contexts: travel, accommodation, local experiences.
  8. 特产 (tèchǎn)
    • pinyin: tèchǎn
    • definition: local specialty product
    • usage: a product for which a particular place is famous.
    • example: 这种茶叶是当地的特产。(zhè zhǒng cháyè shì dāngdì de tèchǎn.) - this type of tea is a local specialty.
    • contexts: travel, shopping, food, souvenirs, local culture.
  9. 时差 (shíchā)
    • pinyin: shíchā
    • definition: time difference; jet lag
    • usage: the difference in time between two places; extreme tiredness and other physical effects felt by a person after a long flight across different time zones.
    • example: 我还在倒时差。(wǒ hái zài dǎo shíchā.) - i am still adjusting to the jet lag.
    • contexts: international travel, time zones, health.
  10. 迷路 (mílù)
    • pinyin: mílù
    • definition: to get lost; to lose one’s way
    • usage: to be unable to find one’s way; not knowing one’s whereabouts.
    • example: 我在陌生的城市迷路了。(wǒ zài mòshēng de chéngshì mílù le.) - i got lost in an unfamiliar city.
    • contexts: travel, navigation, directions.

day 27

  1. 问路 (wènlù)
    • pinyin: wènlù
    • definition: to ask for directions
    • usage: to inquire about the way to a destination.
    • example: 如果找不到地方，可以向当地人问路。(rúguǒ zhǎo bù dào dìfang, kěyǐ xiàng dāngdìrén wènlù.) - if you can’t find the place, you can ask locals for directions.
    • contexts: travel, navigation, communication.
  2. 方向 (fāngxiàng)
    • pinyin: fāngxiàng
    • definition: direction; orientation
    • usage: the course along which someone or something moves or lies.
    • example: 你知道去火车站的方向吗？(nǐ zhīdào qù huǒchēzhàn de fāngxiàng ma?) - do you know the direction to the train station?
    • contexts: navigation, giving/asking for directions.
  3. 左转 (zuǒzhuǎn)
    • pinyin: zuǒzhuǎn
    • definition: to turn left
    • usage: to change direction towards the left.
    • example: 在下一个路口左转。(zài xià yī gè lùkǒu zuǒzhuǎn.) - turn left at the next intersection.
    • contexts: navigation, driving, giving/asking for directions.
  4. 右转 (yòuzhuǎn)
    • pinyin: yòuzhuǎn
    • definition: to turn right
    • usage: to change direction towards the right.
    • example: 一直走，然后右转。(yīzhí zǒu, ránhòu yòuzhuǎn.) - go straight, then turn right.
    • contexts: navigation, driving, giving/asking for directions.
  5. 直走 (zhízǒu)
    • pinyin: zhízǒu
    • definition: to go straight ahead
    • usage: to continue moving forward without turning.
    • example: 从这里直走大约五百米。(cóng zhèlǐ zhízǒu dàyuē wǔbǎi mǐ.) - go straight from here for about 500 meters.
    • contexts: navigation, driving, giving/asking for directions.
  6. 十字路口 (shízì lùkǒu)
    • pinyin: shízì lùkǒu
    • definition: crossroads; intersection
    • usage: a place where two or more roads meet or cross.
    • example: 我们在前面的十字路口停一下。(wǒmen zài qiánmiàn de shízì lùkǒu tíng yīxià.) - let’s stop at the crossroads ahead.
    • contexts: navigation, driving, urban geography.
  7. 红绿灯 (hónglǜdēng)
    • pinyin: hónglǜdēng
    • definition: traffic light
    • usage: a set of automatically operated colored lights, typically red, amber, and green, for controlling traffic at road junctions and pedestrian crossings.
    • example: 请在红绿灯处等候。(qǐng zài hónglǜdēng chù děnghòu.) - please wait at the traffic light.
    • contexts: driving, road safety, urban infrastructure.
  8. 人行道 (rénxíngdào)
    • pinyin: rénxíngdào
    • definition: sidewalk; pavement
    • usage: a paved path for pedestrians at the side of a road.
    • example: 请走人行道，注意安全。(qǐng zǒu rénxíngdào, zhùyì ānquán.) - please walk on the sidewalk and pay attention to safety.
    • contexts: walking, urban infrastructure, road safety.
  9. 斑马线 (bānmǎxiàn)
    • pinyin: bānmǎxiàn
    • definition: crosswalk; zebra crossing
    • usage: a pedestrian crossing marked with broad white stripes.
    • example: 过马路请走斑马线。(guò mǎlù qǐng zǒu bānmǎxiàn.) - please use the crosswalk when crossing the road.
    • contexts: road safety, pedestrian rules, urban infrastructure.
  10. 往返 (wǎngfǎn)
    • pinyin: wǎngfǎn
    • definition: round trip; to go and return
    • usage: a journey to a place and back again.
    • example: 我买的是往返机票。(wǒ mǎi de shì wǎngfǎn jīpiào.) - i bought a round-trip ticket.
    • contexts: travel, tickets, transportation.

day 28

  1. 单程 (dānchéng)
    • pinyin: dānchéng
    • definition: one-way (trip)
    • usage: a journey in one direction only.
    • example: 我只需要买一张单程票。(wǒ zhǐ xūyào mǎi yī zhāng dānchéng piào.) - i only need to buy a one-way ticket.
    • contexts: travel, tickets, transportation.
  2. 出发 (chūfā)
    • pinyin: chūfā
    • definition: to set off; to depart
    • usage: to begin a journey or course.
    • example: 我们明天早上七点出发。(wǒmen míngtiān zǎoshang qī diǎn chūfā.) - we will set off at 7 am tomorrow morning.
    • contexts: travel, journeys, scheduling.
  3. 到达 (dàodá)
    • pinyin: dàodá
    • definition: to arrive; to reach
    • usage: to reach a place at the end of a journey or a stage in a journey.
    • example: 预计下午五点到达目的地。(yùjì xiàwǔ wǔ diǎn dàodá mùdìdì.) - estimated arrival at the destination is 5 pm.
    • contexts: travel, journeys, scheduling.
  4. 延误 (yánwù)
    • pinyin: yánwù
    • definition: delay; to be delayed
    • usage: a situation in which something happens later than it should.
    • example: 由于天气原因，航班延误了。(yóuyú tiānqì yuányīn, hángbān yánwù le.) - the flight was delayed due to weather reasons.
    • contexts: travel (flights, trains), scheduling, problems.
  5. 取消 (qǔxiāo)
    • pinyin: qǔxiāo
    • definition: to cancel
    • usage: to decide that an arranged event will not take place.
    • example: 由于乘客不足，这个航班被取消了。(yóuyú chéngkè bùzú, zhège hángbān bèi qǔxiāo le.) - this flight was canceled due to insufficient passengers.
    • contexts: travel, events, appointments, plans.
  6. 换乘 (huànchéng)
    • pinyin: huànchéng
    • definition: to transfer (between vehicles); to change (trains, buses, etc.)
    • usage: to move from one form of transport to another during a journey.
    • example: 我需要在下一站换乘地铁。(wǒ xūyào zài xià yī zhàn huànchéng dìtiě.) - i need to transfer to the subway at the next stop.
    • contexts: public transportation, travel routes, journeys.
  7. 直达 (zhídá)
    • pinyin: zhídá
    • definition: direct (flight, train, etc.); non-stop
    • usage: going from one place to another without changing (trains, buses, etc.) or stopping.
    • example: 有没有直达上海的火车？(yǒu méiyǒu zhídá shànghǎi de huǒchē?) - is there a direct train to shanghai?
    • contexts: travel, transportation routes, convenience.
  8. 航站楼 (hángzhànlóu)
    • pinyin: hángzhànlóu
    • definition: airport terminal
    • usage: a building at an airport where passengers transfer between ground transportation and the facilities that allow them to board and disembark from aircraft.
    • example: 国际航班在二号航站楼。(guójì hángbān zài èr hào hángzhànlóu.) - international flights are in terminal 2.
    • contexts: airports, air travel.
  9. 经济舱 (jīngjìcāng)
    • pinyin: jīngjìcāng
    • definition: economy class (on a plane, train, etc.)
    • usage: the cheapest class of seating on an aircraft or train.
    • example: 我通常选择坐经济舱。(wǒ tōngcháng xuǎnzé zuò jīngjìcāng.) - i usually choose to fly economy class.
    • contexts: air travel, train travel, budget.
  10. 商务舱 (shāngwùcāng)
    • pinyin: shāngwùcāng
    • definition: business class (on a plane, train, etc.)
    • usage: a class of seating on an aircraft or train that is more expensive than economy class but cheaper than first class, offering more space and better service.
    • example: 公司出差可以报销商务舱。(gōngsī chūchāi kěyǐ bàoxiāo shāngwùcāng.) - the company reimburses for business class on business trips.
    • contexts: air travel, train travel, business travel, comfort.
